page.title: 02 St Giles Church
page.content: There are two churches in the Eastern half of the block, and both are Church of England. The church at {Kellaways}is dedicated to St. Giles, the patron saint of cripples. The church was originally situated behind the corn mill on the River Avon but sometime between 1802 and 1811 it was moved across the road because the rats from the mill frightened the young ladies, who would then not come to church. The church is built of Bath stone with lancet windows East and West, where the porch is. It has a single bell in a small belfry. There is a service once a month taken by the vicar of Sutton Benger.
